On 8/22/06, Dave Brosius <dbrosius@...> wrote:
> I once got flack that some code that was generated from xml wasn't unit tested.
> So i updated the parser/generator to generate unit tests too.
>
> 100% coverage.
>
> gigo

Maybe. On the otherhand, if a programmer-written object is best tested
by that programmer, then is not a auto-generated object also best
tested by an auto-generated test?

This makes perfect sense to me. Because, hopefully, the programmer
that wrote the auto-generate code will know enough about what they are
doing and why they're doing it, that they can also code some
auto-generated tests to make appropriate assertions about that code.

Simon
